}} 'Cygnus 1', also known as 'Orbital Sciences COTS Demo Flight', is
the first planned flight of the Orbital Sciences' unmanned resupply spacecraft
Cygnus, its first flight to the International Space Station and the second
launch of the company's Antares launch vehicle. The flight is under contract to
NASA as Cygnus' demonstration mission in the Commercial Orbital Transportation
Services (COTS) program. The mission is scheduled to launch in April 2013. When berthed, it will become the 5th unmanned vehicle type
to deliver supplies to the station. The other vehicles are the Progress, ATV,
HTV and the Dragon. The Cygnus is expected to deliver of cargo to ISS and
dispose of about through destructive reentry.
categories: Supply vehicles for the International Space Station
